intro: Restio ischaemoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a species of flowering plant in the Restionaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Restio ischaemoides plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy environments and supporting local wildlife.
